item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, December 13, 2024 at 10:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Exotic new superconductors delight and confound (100 points | 25 comments)
2. The Pentium FDIV bug, reverse-engineered (64 points | 11 comments)
3. Show HN: @smoores/epub, a JavaScript library for working with EPUB publications (48 points | 22 comments)
4. Making my first robot as a software engineer (153 points | 17 comments)
5. Show HN: Imposter Attack – Among Us-themed infrared game made with ESP32 (120 points | 23 comments)
6. Web Origami, for making websites where you can understand how they’re made (143 points | 35 comments)
7. An Italian town that built its own sun (2021) (61 points | 21 comments)
8. Noninvasive imaging method can penetrate deeper into living tissue (135 points | 15 comments)
9. MarkItDown: Python tool for converting files and office documents to Markdown (168 points | 46 comments)
10. Ask HN: What should I do with meet.hn? (104 points | 76 comments)
11. “All your base are belong to us” intro to my 2004 MIT Spam Conference talk (35 points | 15 comments)
12. Donald Bitzer has died (134 points | 13 comments)
13. Elon Musk wanted an OpenAI for-profit (203 points | 212 comments)
14. SCCS roach motel (18 points | 1 comment)
15. The Masterpiece Hannah Arendt Died Writing (7 points | discuss)
16. HyperDX (YC S22) is hiring engineers to build open source observability ( | hide)
17. 0x01 – Killing Windows Kernel Mitigations (44 points | 4 comments)
18. Bit-permuting 16 u32s at once with AVX-512 (25 points | discuss)
19. Show HN: Rain hashes – well designed, simple and fast variable sized hashes (62 points | 20 comments)
20. Garbage collected smart pointers in Rust via concurrent cycle collection (90 points | 45 comments)
21. NASA believes it understands why Ingenuity crashed on Mars (34 points | 17 comments)
22. New Meta FAIR Research and Models (4 points | discuss)
23. Animals in Espionage (19 points | 5 comments)
24. Evaporograph and Infra Red Images (11 points | discuss)
25. Test (354 points | 84 comments)
26. OpenAI whistleblower found dead in San Francisco apartment (21 points | 4 comments)
27. The Errors of TeX [pdf] (1989) (17 points | 2 comments)
28. Fermat's Last Theorem – how it’s going (363 points | 184 comments)
29. Three mistakes from Dart/Flutter's weak PRNG (64 points | 65 comments)
30. A new video captures a 1968 demo of IBM’s Executive Terminal (306 points | 81 comments)
